title: Are you happy with your relationship status? - Quora

response.answer_text: well right now am single because my relationship was at such a point where you can actually call it toxic . I used to give more than my 100% and the guy was not even interested in talking to me ,well yeah that shit hurts but you have to accept the reality now he calls me and texts me all the time but until and unless i move on from him am not gonna reply to again fall for this toxic person.. and coming back to the question , yes i am happy because i am at peace with myself , i sometimes feel like what if he's got changed or something like that but on the other hand i know how many chances I've given to this relationship so i feel really good because I have tried everything and even it still didn't work out , it's none of my fault❤️

I am very happy with my relationship with my wife. We have been together since Jan 2007 and got married in October 2010. We have a little boy too, 5 years old. We do have a lot of fights but most of the time laugh at how stupid the fights are later. We love to cook together, we travel, she laughs at my jokes even when she doesn’t find them funny, she listens to my endless boring observations of people, religion, motivation,etc. I have always hated big crowds, parties. She is the opposite, to show her that I wanted to enjoy stuff that she enjoyed too - with her - I had 6 B52 shots and sang on a karoke night in front of 30 people. I sang Tina Turner - I will survive. I think that is the day she is realized I was the most weirdest person she ever met. And we got along just fine :) We have complimented each other and have tweaked so many things in the last 10 years. You have to be open to change and criticism, amazing things can happen if you are.

I’m very happy with my wife as I’ve been hurt on more than once by past girlfriends and I can’t speak for my wife but she tells me she’s very happy too as I’m always doing things to make sure she’s happy and satisfied with how I treat her plus she knows that she wants something I’m going to do my best to get it for her or die trying if possible not that she’s going to ask for something we can’t afford or could do without because we really don’t need it in the first place but all in all she has more going for her and has more than her first husband ever did for her and I giver her everything she wants too sometimes without her even asking for something she comes to find out after she gets it too.

Are you kidding me? HELL YEAH!!! Let's consider the following points No girlfriend=less b.s. and drama.No girlfriend means no wasteful shopping sprees (a true blessing for a broke ass fellow like me).No girlfriend means no worries as to text her first thing in the morning, and always attend to her calls.You can be free to interact with your other female friends.You can always “crack a cold one open with the boys”, without any worries.No case of self hate or self pity,in case she leaves.You can flirt with any girl you like.No arguments or fights over petty issues.And the best one, according to me,is No texts like sona, babu, baby, jaanu etc., And no shit like mele baabu ne thana thaaya?( Indian people will understand ;) )So, yeah. SINGLE. And content. Cheers :)

In relationship satisfaction is inversely proportional to conditions. Love blossoms with commonality and wither with differences. Within a short time, only limited qualities of a person is visible. As life progresses, it unfolds repulsive qualities. People want to deal with successes and strengths and not failures and weaknesses. Everyone expects perfect man/women but they themselves are fallible. Our perspective changes with expectations. Relationship survives on accepting people as they are and not how you want them to be. Periodic sacrifice is the only solution for satisfied long lasting eternal relationship. I am not in a relationship because my girl did not accept my proposal but if she would have then this would have been my approach.

I am. We separated last year, have been living apart, don’t have any plans on getting back together but finally his anger is subsiding and has realized he enjoys his “freedom”, which is making him a happier person and I’ve been much happier too and making much needed home repairs. Don’t plan on changing this as we’ve tried to the past 12 years. We are much happier the way things are.

Yes. Even I am the happiest because I am feeling this relationship will last our life long. It may seems like over confident but for me it is the confidence that we will never give more priority to other things over our love. I do have failed miserably in the previous relationship where I have ruined everything on my own. The pain I have got from my previous experience I don’t want to give that to my partner. She love me lot because I love her and I love her more because of that.
I am Not in a Romantic relationship as of now but as far as other relationships are concerned I’m pretty happy! i.e My friends and family are my Elixir.

My wife is literally my best friend. always there when I need herAlways supportive in my endeavoursStraightens me out if I’m bullshitingA level of intimacy that’s specialWould do anything for meShe makes me cope with life betterFriends come and go, a wife is for life.
Yes. They are casual, non committed, non exclusive relationships. This is much happier for me.
Yes, cuz I'm being my self now
DEFINITELY NOT.But it could be simply because I am waiting to be in one.
Yes, I am very happy alone.
